item.title: Sorry!
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

[quote=“cwg452003, post:4, topic:218393”]O sorry i didn’t delete the “;” after the if statement, here you go.

if (IsItemInBag(1497) && IsItemInBag(1498) && IsItemInBag(1499)) { tele(2313, 9815); deleteItem(1497, GetItemSlot(1497), 1); deleteItem(1498, GetItemSlot(1498), 1); deleteItem(1499, GetItemSlot(1499), 1); sendMessage("You amulets seem to disappear as you walk through the portal!"); } else { showitem(1497, "You need to have all three demonic amulets in"," your inventory to pass this door!"); } break;[/quote]

No need for == true, changed it in the quote above.

item.title: Sorry!
item.dc:creator: @Zhaedara Zhaedara
item.description:
@Zhaedara wrote:

Sorry the other one was supposed to be my last one like wtf
But anyway how do i make it so that i need like…lets say 3 amulets to pass a magic portal…How would i do this? I have tried multiple ways:

if(IsItemInBag(1497, 1498, 1499) == true);

^^Doesnt work because it cannot be applied to (int, int, int)

if (IsItemInBag(1497) == true); if (IsItemInBag(1498) == true); if (IsItemInBag(1499) == true) { tele(2313, 9815); deleteItem(1497, GetItemSlot(1497), 1); deleteItem(1498, GetItemSlot(1498), 1); deleteItem(1499, GetItemSlot(1499), 1); sendMessage("You amulets seem to disappear as you walk through the portal!"); } else { showitem(1497, "You need to have all three demonic amulets in", "your inventory to pass this door!"); } break;
^^Does not work because you will pass through only if you have 1/3 amulets

PLZ HELP

Read full topic
